get.description: Lists all of the available Media Services REST API operations.

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2015-10-01.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Success. Returns a list of operations.

schema.description: Result of the request to list Media Services operations.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

value.description: List of Media Services operations supported by the Microsoft.Media resource provider.

items.description: A Media Services REST API operation

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Invoice, etc.

post.description: Checks whether the Media Service resource name is available. The name must be globally unique.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for a Microsoft Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2015-10-01.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Success. Returns details about whether a Media Service resource name is available.

schema.description: The response body for CheckNameAvailability API.

message.description: Specifies the detailed reason if the name is not available.

nameAvailable.description: Specifies if the name is available.

reason.description: Specifies the reason if the name is not available.

value.message: Already in use by another Media Service instance. Please try again with a name that is not likely to be in use.

default.description: CheckNameAvailability of a Media Service failed.

schema.description: The error returned from a failed Media Services REST API call.

error.message: Name availability check is not supported for type Microsoft.Media/mediaservices.

schema.description: The request body for CheckNameAvailability API.

name.description: The name of the resource. A name must be globally unique.

type.description: The type of the resource - mediaservices.

requestBody.description: Properties needed to check the availability of a name.

get.description: Lists all of the Media Services in a resource group.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for a Microsoft Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2015-10-01.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

200.description: Success. Returns a list of all of the Media Services accounts in a resource group.

schema.description: The collection of Media Service resources.

value.description: The collection of Media Service resources.

id.description: The id of the resource.

location.description: The geographic location of the resource. This must be one of the supported and registered Azure Geo Regions (for example, West US, East US, Southeast Asia, and so forth).

tags.description: Tags to help categorize the resource in the Azure portal.

items.description: The properties of a Media Service resource.

properties.description: The additional properties of a Media Service resource.

apiEndpoints.description: Read-only property that lists the Media Services REST API endpoints for this resource. If supplied on a PUT or PATCH, the value will be ignored.

items.description: The properties for a Media Services REST API endpoint.

majorVersion.description: The version of Media Services REST API.

storageAccounts.description: The storage accounts for this resource.

items.description: The properties of a storage account associated with this resource.

id.description: The id of the storage account resource. Media Services relies on tables and queues as well as blobs, so the primary storage account must be a Standard Storage account (either Microsoft.ClassicStorage or Microsoft.Storage). Blob only storage accounts can be added as secondary storage accounts (isPrimary false).

isPrimary.description: Is this storage account resource the primary storage account for the Media Service resource. Blob only storage must set this to false.

schema.description: The error returned from a failed Media Services REST API call.

error.message: Name availability check is not supported for type Microsoft.Media/mediaservices.

parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. The current version is 2015-10-01.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: Name of the Media Service.
parameters.name: mediaServiceName
